resources.string:
• Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.

 • Curl up and forward so that your head, neck, and shoulder blades lift off the floor.

 • Hold for a moment at the top and then lower back down.

• Lie on your back with bent knees.

 • Prop your right ankle on the upper thigh of your bent left knee.

 • With the hand behind your head, perform crunches toward the right knee.

• Lie on your back with bent knees.

 • Prop your left ankle on the upper thigh of your bent right knee.

 • With the hand behind your head, perform crunches toward the left knee.

• Press your lower back to the ground and contract your core muscles.

 • Lift your knees to a 45-degree angle.

 • Slowly go through a bicycle pedal motion.

• Place your hands behind the head.

 • Bring the knees in towards the chest until they're bent to 90 degrees.

 • Contract the abs to curl the hips off the floor.

• Lie on your back with your arms over your head.

 • Keep your knees bent with feet flat on the floor.

 • Contract your abs and lift your shoulder blades off the floor.

• Lie on your back with your knees bent and feet flat on the floor.

 • Cross your right leg over your left leg.

 • Contract your abdominal muscles, twist your torso and touch your left elbow to your right knee.

• Place your palms on your thighs.

 • Contract your abdominal muscles and curl up until your fingertips reach your knees.

 • Slowly lower to the start position.

• Extend the legs straight up with knees crossed.

 • Contract the abs to lift the shoulder blades off the floor.

 • Keep the legs in a fixed position.

• Lie face down on mat resting on the forearms.

 • Push off the floor, raising up onto toes and resting on the elbows.

 • Hold your back flat for 30 seconds.

• Lie down on the right side of your body.

 • Stretch you right arm long and relax your head down.

 • Pull your abdominals, exhale and raise your right leg up and down.

• Lie on left side, supported on elbow, legs long and slightly in front of body.

 • Raise right leg to hip height.

 • Pulse, inhale, lengthen leg to back.

• Lie down in a straight line.

 • Bring your right leg over top of your left long leg and place your foot on to your mat.

 • Pull your abdominals in, exhale and raise your left leg up and down.

• Lie down on the left side of your body.

 • Stretch you left arm long and relax your head down.

 • Pull your abdominals, exhale and raise your left leg up and down.

• Lie on left side, supported on elbow, legs long and slightly in front of body.

 • Raise right leg to hip height.

 • Pulse, inhale, lengthen leg to back.

• Lie down in a straight line.

 • Bring your left leg over top of your right long leg and place your foot on to your mat.

 • Pull your abdominals in (belly button to spine) exhale and raise your right leg up and down.

• Lie flat on your stomach, resting your head on your forearms.

 • Bend at knees to pull dumbbell toward butt.

 • Stay in a straight line, do not allow the dumbbell to drift to one side of the body.

• Sitting in a chair with your abs contracted, extend your leg with your foot up, knee straight.

 • Slightly raise your thigh off the chair, lower and repeat.

 • Repeat with the other leg.

• Step your right foot forward, raise left.

 • Bend both knees to lower body down as far as possible.

 • Exhale and extend both knees up to return to starting position.

• Step your left foot forward, raise right.

 • Bend both knees to lower body down as far as possible.

 • Exhale and extend both knees up to return to starting position.

• Stand with your legs hip-width apart, knees soft.

 • Exhale as you slowly straighten arms until they are straight-up toward the ceiling.

 • Inhale as you return your arms back to the starting position.

• Pull your abdominals in, stand tall, and keep your knees slightly bent.

 • Curl both arms upward until they’re in front of your shoulders.

 • Slowly lower the dumbbells back down.

• Take your right arm over your head and your left hand behind your back at waist height.

 • With the band behind your back pull the band tight.

 • Extend your right arm up towards the ceiling and then back down.

• Take your left arm over your head and your right hand behind your back at waist height.

 • With the band behind your back pull the band tight.

 • Extend your left arm up towards the ceiling and then back down.

• Keep the torso stationary and lift the barbell to you.

 • At the top contracted position, squeeze the back muscles and hold for a brief pause.

 • Lower the barbell back to the starting position.
• Position dumbbells in front of upper legs.\n\n • Raise dumbbells forward and upward until upper arms are above horizontal.

• Sit down on floor with knees bent, feet on floor, and push up bars behind buttocks.

 • Raise one leg off of the ground so that raised leg is parallel with the ground.

 • Bend elbows to lower body down to the ground.
• Place your hands directly under your shoulders.\n\n • Bend your arms to about 90 and lower your body, keeping your head in line with your spine.
• Lie on your left side with your knees straight.\n\n • Raise your hips until your body forms a straight line from your ankles to your shoulders
• Lie on your right side with your knees straight.\n\n • Raise your hips until your body forms a straight line from your ankles to your shoulders
• Stand with your feet slightly wider than hip-width apart, back straight, shoulders down.\n\n • Lower your body down, until your thighs are parallel to the ground.
• Step forward with one leg and lower your body to 90 degrees at both knees.\n\n • Push up and back to the starting position.
• Take a large step to the side and lunge toward the floor.\n\n • Push off through your right foot to return to the start to complete one.

• Squat down and grasp bar with shoulder width.

 • Lift bar by extending hips and knees to full extension.

 • Pull shoulders back at top of lift if rounded.
• Bend over and place your palms on the floor three feet in front of your toes.\n\n • Extend your left leg, then push off your right foot.
• Bend over and place your palms on the floor three feet in front of your toes.\n\n • Extend your right leg, then push off your left foot.
• Lie flat on the floor.\n\n • Lift your hips off the floor while keeping your back straight.
• Sit on the padded seat.\n\n • Hold the head steady, grip the bars firmly at each side.
• Contract your abs and keep them tight throughout the exercise.\n\n • Raise on leg up a few inches and bring it back to the starting position.

• Lie down on the bench with your hips on the edge and your legs tucked underneath.

 • Fully extend both legs straight out.

 • Pull your knees back into the tucked position.
